answers.answer: When in doubt go in even though you feel they may send you back. Your baby's life is more important and it's not about being a ftm. Do all you can until you feel your baby move to your satisfaction.

No matter what the baby should at least move 10 times in 2 hrs. Otherwise you need to contact your doc/midwife. you can try having a sugary drink or orange juice n then lying on your left side for a while and thn start counting again. If your counts still dont reach 10 at the end of 2 hrs call your doctor immediately.
Lots of water and lay on your left side

just what newmummy2b posted..this was on tv in uk last week..a charity called count the kicks and how mums should monitor babies kicks not only count but monitor their pattern..google the site if u want, there was a us site too..but the advice was if you feel the way you do go straight and get checked

question: I am thirty weeks as of today; however, I am starting to feel little to no movement over the past 2 or 3 days. Since about 16 weeks, I have felt her almost non-stop. I have gained about 45 pounds so far, so much that my doctor had me really watch what I eat lately, and on top of that, I have been battling a cold. No gestational diabetes though. I'm not sure if it's me being sick or changing my diet, but do you think I should be worried? I also have a fetal doppler I used today and her heart beat seems fine. I guess I'm just a worrying first time momma to be since she is hardly moving the past few days.
title: 30 weeks today. Little to no movement.
